Steps to reproduce:

I am a fan of "Getting Things Done (GTD)" Core element is a task list that is sorted by categories. Therefore I used the "sort by category view" in tasks.


Actual results:

Lightning displayed all my tasks (approx 150) sorted by categories. This required a lot of scrolling as most of the task were not relevant at the moment.


Expected results:

Microsoft Outlook has "expandable lists" for tasks. This view displays only the category. By clicking on o category it shows all the tasks in that category (like a folder with sub-folders on the harddrive). This is more efficient to work this. I would LOVE to have the same in Lightning.

comments.raw_text: I think Title / Location / Category / Description would be a good set of property options for the text filter - there's a proposal mock-up for this in bug 728011 (please ignore the typo in the mock-up, Category was supposed to be one of the options). Also I think a single (and possibly multiple) Category selector would be a good choice for an optional toolbar item in the task filter bar.
